definition: unofficial history/history as popular legends
field/plain/open space/limit/boundary/rude/feral
history/annals/title of an official historian in ancient China
surname Shi

sentences.english: Wang Baochuan is the unofficial history of spoony women "model".
sentences.chinese: 王寶釧是唐朝野史中癡情烈女的“楷模”。

sentences.english: Mandarin "is the earliest Chinese a kingdom and texts."
sentences.chinese: 國語》是中國最早的一部國野史鉅著。

sentences.english: According to unofficial accounts, an amusing(funny) episode(incident) took place during this long and drawn out journey.
sentences.chinese: 據野史記載，在這漫長的旅途中還發生了一件趣事。

sentences.english: This is unofficial word of mouth, of course, does not see the True Story.
sentences.chinese: 當然此乃口口相傳野史，並不見正傳。

sentences.english: According to unofficial accounts，an amusing episode took place during this long and drawn out journey.
sentences.chinese: 據野史記載，在這漫長的旅途中還發生了一件趣事。

sentences.english: According to the unofficial history, an interesting thing happened during the long journey.
sentences.chinese: 據野史記載，在這漫長的旅途中還發生了一件趣事。

sentences.english: Many interesting stories originated from unofficial histories.
sentences.chinese: 許多有趣的故事源自於稗官野史。

definition: the 24 or 25 official dynastic histories/true history, as opposed to fictional adaptation or popular legends
history book
anecdote/apocryphal story
historical material or data

dramatic form consisting of historical narration/history as jocular narrative/to stretch history for a joking story/amusing story with strained interpretations of history/to make an unreasonable comparison in jest
History of the Ming Dynasty, twenty fourth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Zhang Tingyu 張廷玉|张廷玉[Zhang1 Ting2 yu4] in 1739 during the Qing Dynasty, 332 scrolls
various notes or records/a miscellany/scattered jottings
Records of the Grand Historian, by 司馬遷|司马迁[Si1 ma3 Qian1], first of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3]
historical records
History of the Former Han Dynasty, second of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], composed by Ban Gu 班固[Ban1 Gu4] in 82 during Eastern Han (later Han), 100 scrolls

Draft History of the Qing Dynasty, sometimes listed as number 25 or 26 of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Zhao Erxun 趙爾巽|赵尔巽[Zhao4 Er3 xun4] in 1927 during the Northern Warlords period, 536 scrolls

A Mirror for the Wise Ruler (or Comprehensive Mirror for Aid in Government), a vast chronological general history, written by 司馬光|司马光[Si1 ma3 Guang1] Sima Guang (1019-1089) and collaborators during the Northern Song in 1084, covering the period 403 BC-959 AD, 294 scrolls
History of the Jin Dynasty, fifth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Fang Xuanling 房玄齡|房玄龄[Fang2 Xuan2 ling2] in 648 during Tang Dynasty 唐朝[Tang2 chao2], 130 scrolls

History of the Later Tang Dynasty, seventeenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Ouyang Xiu 歐陽修|欧阳修[Ou1 yang2 Xiu1] and Song Qi 宋祁[Song4 Qi2] in 1060 during Northern Song 北宋[Bei3 Song4], 225 scrolls

History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
variant of 逸事[yi4 shi4]
